package.name: Pager_Sliding
package.description: It takes an array of data as input and page it according to various parameters. It also builds links within a specified range, and allows complete customization of the output (it even works with mod_rewrite). It is compatible with PEAR::Pager's API

release.notes: - changed from this (supposing currentPage==2): [1] < 2 3 4 5 6 > [N] to: [1] < 1 2 3 4 5 > [N] i.e. now the link to the first/last page can be redundant, but the pager acts in a more intuitive way - getOffsetByPageId() now works as expected, also in "expanded" mode - reduced calls to internal methods - Added two new variables: * firstPageText * lastPageText They allow changing the default value "[1]" to "First", for instance. Same for last number. If they are not set, they default to the number.

- changed from this (supposing currentPage==2): [1] < 2 3 4 5 6 > [N] to: [1] < 1 2 3 4 5 > [N] i.e. now the link to the first/last page can be redundant, but the pager acts in a more intuitive way - getOffsetByPageId() now works as expected, also in "expanded" mode - reduced calls to internal methods - Added two new variables: * firstPageText * lastPageText They allow changing the default value "[1]" to "First", for instance. Same for last number. If they are not set, they default to the number.
Added a select box builder: now the user can choose how many items to display per page. This value can be stored in a session var.
Added pageID optional parameter to getLinks(). If it is specified, links for that page are provided instead of current one.
This is the initial release of the Pager_Sliding package.
